intro: Physena madagascariensis var. longifolia, commonly known as the Madagascar physena, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
